{"step_by_step_thinking": "In a case-control study, an odds ratio (OR) greater than 1 indicates a higher risk of the disease in the exposed group compared to the unexposed group. Therefore, the causative factors for breast cancer in this study would be those with an OR greater than 1. Looking at the table, the parameters with an OR greater than 1 are 'Age at menarche >12', 'Menopause', 'OCP use', and 'Family history'. So, there are 4 causative factors.", "answer_choice": "D. 2"}
